title: Reference
description: A reference to a creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

type.$comment: This is a special property analogous to JSON-LD's `@type` keyword.

id.$comment: This is a special property analogous to JSON-LD's `@id` keyword.

workType.description: The type of `CreativeWork` being referenced(e.g. Article, Book, Dataset).

doi.description: The Digital Object Identifier (https://doi.org/) of the work being referenced.

editors.description: People who edited the referenced work.
editors.$comment:
Note that, consistent with schema.org, this property can only include
a `Person`, unlike `authors` which can also include `Organization`.

publisher.description: A publisher of the referenced work.

title.description: The title of the referenced work.
title.$comment:
An array of inlines (rather than a string) to be consistent with `CreativeWork.title`
and allow for italicization of species names, math etc.

isPartOf.description: Another `Reference` that this reference is a part of.

volumeNumber.description: Identifies the volume of publication or multi-part work; for example, "iii" or "2".

issueNumber.description: Identifies the issue of a serial publication; for example, "3" or "12".

pageStart.description: The page on which the article starts; for example "135" or "xiii".

pageEnd.description: The page on which the article ends; for example "138" or "xvi".

pagination.description: Any description of pages that is not separated into pageStart and pageEnd; for example, "1-6, 9, 55".

version.description: The version/edition of the referenced work.
version.$comment:
In this case `string` is listed as an alternative before `number` to
avoid semantic version numbers e.g. `1.0` being parsed, and subsequently
encoded, as `1` thereby resulting in loss of information.

identifiers.description: Any kind of identifier for the referenced work.
identifiers.$comment:
Some identifiers have specific properties e.g the `doi` property.
These should be used in preference to this property which is intended
for identifiers that do not yet have a specific property like ISBN.
Identifiers can be represented as strings, but using a `PropertyValue`
will usually be better because it allows for `propertyID` (i.e. the type of identifier).

url.description: The URL of the referenced work.
